byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Washington, and Danny Hakim from London.
byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and DANNY HAKIM

abstract: United States naval destroyer is deployed and aircraft are put on standby after Iran takes control of Marshall Islands-flagged cargo ship in Strait of Hormuz, claiming it was trespassing; American officials play down incident, hoping it will not have adverse effect on current negotiations over Iran's nuclear program.
lead_paragraph: A Pentagon official said that the cargo ship, the Maersk Tigris, was intercepted by Iranian patrol boats while traveling through the Strait of Hormuz.

headline.main: U.S. Sends Destroyer After Iran Detains Ship
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sends Destroyer After Iran Detains Ship

snippet: A Pentagon official said that the cargo ship, the Maersk Tigris, was intercepted by Iranian patrol boats while traveling through the Strait of Hormuz.
